title: Did chat restrictions get removed?
body:
I just got my first punishment ever on that account and I instantly got 2 weeks ban on that account. I agree I was toxic and I blame it on myself, but that's not the point.
My other friends who were toxic before got chat restrictions for 10, 25 games and then 2 weeks, after that a permban.
Is this intended? Or is the system bugged?

replies.body:
Chat restrictions do exist.

They are the lightest form of penalty. An escalation schedule exists that will increase the severity of penalties for players who constantly get them. However, that does not mean that the first penalty every player gets is a chat restriction.

> Is this intended? Or is the system bugged?

It is intended. Please do be aware that the next penalty after a 14-day ban, without showing sufficient reform, is a permanent ban.

I got banned 2 times a few months after each other for 2 weeks each and I was really toxic but now I'm reformed and I talk nicely in chat and I don't cuss or flame and I'm friendly now. Now I don't plan to fall off the wagon but if I did is it without a doubt perma for me ?
No. You can certainly get your account back into good status.
So it's possible that if I'm in good status it will reset my rating as if I'd never been banned?
Correct

I was playing more or less in a good behaviour last 2 months, playing 2 or 3 games/day (sometimes 0, sometimes much more, you know), today I was toxic and I got banned (it's ok i deserved it{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} ), I though i was getting better on rating during this 2 months....
I read that it depends of players situation,anyway might there is a maximum time/games.

-How much time/games can it take maximum? (Is the same for get again rewards/improved rating enough for don't permaban?)
-Is there any notification about your increased rating? 
-Being a passive player (/muteall) is useful too in this?

I'm conscious of permaban so I would like to know how to avoid it because I wasn't toxic until a year ago.
It would be a pity lose all those hours spent because of my rage in some games{{champion:32}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:32}} 
Thx
Absolutely.

As far as I'm aware, you do get feedback from the system when you've been reported.

I haven't been banned but I did get a chat restriction on a new account without using profanity, racial slurs, homophobic remarks, ad hominems etc. or anything of the nature. It was mainly just a disagreement about champion viability and apparently that's not allowed on here. I NEVER received ANY warning. The first thing was a chat restriction for 10 games and the "evidence" was complete BS. Even totally out of context so as to make me look crazy and angry, it still seemed like complete BS. People control what you can say if they don't like it even if you are not objectively being rude about it. However, that's not what's under discussion now. You do NOT get any warning prior to punishment as the game is now and you also never get any notification of having been reported for any game.

Actually it would for me. I didn't feel like I was really that toxic, and I got 2 weeks banned as the first punishment ever after 2 games. It shows only 2 games and the first one is like a month old and the second one is like from 3 games before I actaully got banned. It would because it would've told me I should calm down and that I'm close to a restriction. Probs would stop me from playing when I was tilted.
ya system is a joke. whether riot employees think so or not. It does help, but you can get chat restrict from saying absolutely nothing like my most recent experience

>That seems excessive without any prior warning.  

**This **is the warning. Ultimately, everything builds to Permabans and, as such, everything before is a warning. Depending on the severity of the behavior determines the severity of the warning.
I don't see how one needs a warning for hate speech or feeding. Do you honestly think people need warnings telling players "that's bad, don't do it again or..."?
You do get warned. It's called the ToS lol.
getting chat restricted just because a big group reported you, is stupid. They were the most toxic people ive ever seen and i got in trouble for nothing .zz
Multiple reports don't do anyone more than a single report.
hm.... i have stories with friends that were banned because they were reported by a premade team enemy. Did they not know what they were talking about?

Those stories were just downright them not even knowing that 1 report and 9 reports does the exact same thing.

Some of the people whom are mildly toxic don't realise that they are toxic, even when given the chat logs.

So their only explanation they can think of is to blame it on "how crappy the system is" instead of looking to change themselves.
So what about rewards at the end of the season? Am I still eligible?

Chat restrictions still exist. Certainly behaviors, however -- usually intentionally feeding, use of hate speech, or encouragements to self-harm -- typically earn escalated punishments due to the zero tolerance policies Riot has in place for those behaviors.

If you have your chat logs we can help you find the specific bits that might have been an issue in your punishment.

I obviously deserved it, but I have been banned before on my previous accounts.

This is an account that I have never been restricted before - and because I got instantly banned for 2 weeks, whilst on the previous accounts I was banned/restricted before - it gave me 2 chat restrictions <10 and 25 games> before actually banning for 2 weeks. It happened to a few of my friends too after the honor system was added. What's up with it? Why am I not restricted instead of being banned?

> [{quoted}](name=SpeedVolume,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PVEOEOcE,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-07-13T19:45:37.442+0000)What's up with it? Why am I not restricted instead of being banned?

As I said, *certain behaviors can cause escalated punishments*. We'd need to see your chat logs to see if that behavior is present.

> previous accounts I was banned/restricted before - it gave me 2 chat restrictions <10 and 25 games> before actually banning for 2 weeks

This does not help your cause. I get that it's a new account and a new you, but you're telling me that after getting other accounts banned you still do things that get you punished? Something's off with your assessment of yourself. I don't think you'd change your behavior with a warning based on these factors.

Generally, statements like "kill yourself", other statements inciting harm to others, or use of homophobic or racist slurs can get you an escalated ban. If any of that showed up, especially something that's going to get converted to %%%s in the chat filter, it's likely the reason for skipping a tier.

1st you get the "You've been acting unsportsmanlike" warning in your client then there are chat restrictions and ultimately ban... Ofc if you tell someone to hurt himself or other severe violations of riot policies those "light" forms of punishments are skipped and it's good to be so

EDIT: Also prolonged queue but i guess that doesn't apply for flaming

You do not get the unsportsmanlike error or any other. You used to but now the first thing that happens is a chat restriction (yes, on a new account). 

Also, I found that error inaccurate. It should have been "Some players find you to be unsportsman etc.." instead of pretending it's bestowing you with infallible truth from the gods.
We will all be permabanned eventually. The level of goody-two-shoes required to maintain a "good standing" is far too high for anyone.

How do you explain all the people who have played the game since release and haven't even gotten as much as a warning?
How do you explain the many many people who **have** been punished and managed to reform back to good standing (which is **way** harder than maintain a good standing)
You'd have to first prove that these people exist. But assuming they do, the only explanation is that they never enter chat at all. Riot loves it when people never talk to the team.
